author: {'steamid': '76561199055076448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 195, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1712025472}
review: Under leaves is a hidden object game where you go through different environments helping a variety of animals by pointing and clicking on what that animal is looking for; acorns, fish, slugs, insects, flowers, etc. You can double click to make the screen zoom in a bit and I found that helped me A LOT because some of the hidden objects do appear as the same color of a leaf or branch that they are on. To use a hint you solve a slide puzzle with the name of the game. I appreciated that this game centers around animals and I think the art style is very nice. Under leaves is a very cute game and I would recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053568113', 'num_games_owned': 4851, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 126, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1711728750}
review:
Under Leaves is a very challenging Hidden Object game.

The game is beautiful and the backgrounds are all animated. You have animals giving you quests to find certain items and then you have to find said item X amount of times in 2 to 5 different screens (there's no way to know if there are said items left in a screen or not, you can navigate through them using the arrows on the side of the screen at any time). This makes the game much harder and most items requested are background items (leaves, shells, etc).

The items are also hidden in a variety of colors and they blend with the background perfectly, it took me over TWO HOURS to find everything without hints. The game has a lot more base spawns than those shown in your game, which means that even if you were to look up a guide, chances are the ones you're missing aren't there. I didn't use a guide nor did I use hints, because using hints also disable achievements...

All in all, a very challenging although relaxing experience. If you're looking for a casual hidden object game this isn't it, you will really have to go out of your way to find everything legitimately. Also the music and sound effects are great, ambience music that really fits the game aside from the random drum sounds.

Overall, a little expensive, but it's good, challenging and takes over 2 hours to complete, so it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155568971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 30, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1712409163}
review:
My toddler approves of this cute and colorful game. We've played it together and he enjoys the happy and relaxing scenes as I try to find the hidden objects for the animals. Sadly this game seems to be rather short, but I'm curious to see how well it suits replay, as some of the food objects are very well hidden so far.
Nonetheless I love this game, and will wholeheartedly recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077412171', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1700425144}
review:
Relaxing game with Hidden Object + Soothing Music.
Your goal is just to find the object that is spread over the map/stage. There is many animals which gives you different quests. But they are most the same, just find the object which is hidden somewhere in the stage. 
And some object might be camouflage beside it, because they seems to be the same color.
Or else, everything is cute art and relaxing.

Achievement: Simple and straight forward. (If you don't use "help function", you will get this more quicker.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198124555535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1705803334}
review: I think Under Leaves can best be described as therapeutic or, more simply, calming. I know very little about the "hidden-object" genre, but navigating this game felt like going inside a beautiful tapestry while listening to ambient, nature sounds: subtle piano strokes accompanied by crickets or whale-songs. Yes, there are some scenes that are busy, but none of them felt overwhelming or taxing on the eyes. My daughter also really enjoyed going through the varied landscapes, so I feel it's an experience for any age really. At the end of the day, it's an easy thing to turn on and halfway let your brain relax. I guess its one fault would be its length; however, the art and sound design are impeccable, so I only hope the studio designs more within this style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055157809', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1698277056}
review:
If you play it for the gameplay, it's a very simple yet calming Hidden Object game. If you're an achievement hunter, you might end up losing your mind and eyesight through some of the latter levels.

The first few levels are simple enough, but then the game starts asking you to find increasingly smaller and simpler figures in larger quantities through clustered maps, which might make you go desperate if you're going for the "finish without using help" achievement. The last level was ironically the easiest for me.

All in all, I'd recommend it mostly to people who have patience for this kind of meticulous searching.

[h1]
Pretty charming $1 hidden object game where you find food for wild animals. Some areas are harder than the others and might seem impossible without using help but it's doable. [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198239922912', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 357, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1690384839}
review:
You journey deep into the forest, the jungle or the depths of the deep blue sea. Find acorns for the squirrels, lizards for the snake and so many more. Under Leaves is a colorful hidden object game seen through the world of the animals. The artstyle is a gorgeous hand-drawn watercolor style with soothing soundscape that make for a gentle and chill experience.

The objects are randomized for everyone, but they are not that hard to find. You get achievements for each animal stage completed and one achievement if you play through the game without using any hints. The game as a chill little experience that I can highly recommend.

I think the price of it should be a tab bit cheaper mostly for the fact that the game can be completed quite fast, it took me around 45 minutes to beat, though I am really good at hidden objects games in my opinion, so I guess it might take longer for others.

If you want something short and sweet to play, this is for you! Could even work great for children if they want to learn to enjoy hidden object games. Absolutely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100846123', 'num_games_owned': 931, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1706636155}
review:
My 3 year old niece loves this game, any time I get my steam deck out she wants to play the 'polar bear game' as she calls it.
It's really good for helping kids to learn to recognise colours, shapes, plants and animals and if they are old enough it can help them learn where in the world different animals live and where different countries/continents are. It's also really good to help them develop better observation and memory skills because each level is made up of very similar colour shades, and the objects you need to find are very small and the hidden objects from previous levels are still there so you need to remember which one you are looking for. 

I also like it as an adult, it's just a simple hidden object game really, but I bought it to play with my niece on my steam deck and it makes her very happy to play it which makes me happy that I bought it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044023483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1702686022}
review: Lovely little game that's relaxing and surprisingly difficult sometimes.  Some of the objects are very well hidden. I found the graphics to be stunning, dream like.  They invoke the feeling of simplicity and innocence.  It's like you can pretend for an hour that the world is very small, and life is just about finding the right plants to eat, nothing else is going on.  I especially like the woodland part, large enough to be more interesting.  Of course the critters look so cute.  I think it's a very good game to play before bedtime, and it's suitable for all ages.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019819701', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1681610130}
review:
I will recommend on a few conditions. 
1. You aren't colourblind in any capacity. Some of the contrast is negligible. For me it was always the yellow/orange colours, so maybe women with orange-sensing eye-cones could have an easier time than I did.
2. You don't expect a lot of depth. It really is just a hidden objects game. No twist. Which is fine.
3. You don't mind the lack of volume controls. I just used the sound mixer in the settings, which was fine.
The art really is gorgeous. The game looks great, feels fair, and delivers exactly what it advertises. Definitely would be great for kids, teaching them about habitats and food chains (each item you find is a food source for that animal).

author: {'steamid': '76561199056016268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1679266131}
review:
Un jueguito muy lindo y tranqui, la musica de fondo es relajante y el apartado visual del juego es muy agradable. Los animalitos se ven muy cute, y cada mapa tiene una paleta de colores que ambientan muy bien la zona. A medida que avanzas se dificula un poquito encontrar ciertas cosas, pero no llega al nivel de ser fastidioso, simplemente es como un reto. Lo super recomiento para todos :3 
Lo unico malo que le encuentro es que es muy cortito, pero aun asi es divertido, y como las cosas que hay que buscar cambian de lugar en cada partida, se puede jugar mas de una vez

author: {'steamid': '76561198859381158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1678551510}

author: {'steamid': '76561198272431099', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1679719252}
review:
Absolutely gorgeous game. Not particularly long if you're a fan of hidden object games, but very fun nevertheless. Definitely worth $5. I am so happy I could finally play this game -- I just got a new laptop after my previous one died, and played this. 

If you like art and/or hidden object games, you should [i]definitely[/i] buy it. Seriously, the watercolour paintings have movement within them, and they get progressively harder because what you find is incorporated in the next puzzles.

Because there's no reading besides the credits, I think kids over 3 or 4 might enjoy this with an older person to help on the harder ones.

My only criticism is the lack of tutorial -- it was pretty intuitive to me, but perhaps not to everyone.

Easily a 10/10 game. Genuinely. I hope you enjoy it as much as I did ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561199203827220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1675455652}
review: Das Spiel hat eine schÃ¶ne Atmosphere. Die Laute der Tiere, die Hintergrund GerÃ¤usche und die Musik passt zu allen Gebieten perfekt. Die Suche an sich ist an manchen Stellen etwas schwieriger, aber nach einem kleinen "Minispiel" wird geholfen. Ich rate trotzdem dazu geduldig alles selbst zu suchen, wenn man gerne alle Errungenschaften in einem Spielgang bekommen mÃ¶chte. Das "Zoom in" (durch Doppelklick LMT) ist selbst auch eine kleine Hilfe, fÃ¼r eine aufmerksamere Suche. FÃ¼r alle die Kinder haben und Interesse an Tieren haben, empfehle ich euch denen das Spiel anzubieten und schaut zu, ob sie konzentriert dabei sind und wie lange sie brauchen, finde es interessant :D. Man kann es als kurzes Spiel bezeichnen, trotzdem lohnt es sich, falls man etwas ruhigeres braucht und seine Konzentration aufbauen mÃ¶chte. Alles in einem sehr schÃ¶nes und entspanntes Spiel. (Bin ehrlich, ab und zu habe ich meine Nerven etwas verloren, aber es gehÃ¶rt etwas auch dazu :D)

review: Simple casual game in hidden-object style, where your goal is to find â€œfoodâ€ on 2D monochrome-colored screens to feed the animals â€“ and some of these items can be very difficult to spot. A good and enjoyable game to pass time, and train your perception a little.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290202945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1670630434}
review: This is a really good game for littles. I played this game with my 3 and 5 year old and they never got bored or frustrated. They were too excited to finish the level to see the reveal or flowers bloom and then what the next animal to help would be. It helped them learn to take turns looking for the objective, patience, and focus. Wish they would add more levels/content to extend this game some more. My girls were so disappointed when it was finished but then quickly asked to play it again. Great game with beautiful art and relaxing music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198809955799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1669841937}
review: A hidden objects game where you'll need to collect food for each animal that lives on both sides of the planet: the Pacific and the Atlantic. I found it very interesting, but very tiresome. Some of the items are too well hidden that it is impossible to spot. The player has to use the helping puzzle. I didn't get the last achievement, because I needed to use the helping puzzle. Maybe you'll do better than me. Try it and tell me how it went.

author: {'steamid': '76561199323270944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1676663518}
review: Beautiful and atmospheric, love it

author: {'steamid': '76561199178143683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1671975400}
review: Cute, simple hidden object game. You should be able to beat the game in an hour or so, a little longer if you're trying to get the last achievement. The art is very nice, the music and sound effects are relaxing. It's nice for winding down and de-stressing. Since the item locations are random, you can keep playing again and again. Got on sale, but the full price is fine for what it is. If you like this kind of game, I'd recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198956299818', 'num_games_owned': 2010, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1669359193}
review: This is a really beautiful and simple hidden object game where you need to help the animals find what they are looking for. You need to complete all the levels without using any hints to unlock all the achievements. It takes about an hour to complete, however you might need to idle the game to unlock all the trading cards.

review: It's a good game, but getting that last achievement Under the Leaves where you have to beat the game without using the hint button is hard! I tried looking up a walk through, but it didn't help because I think the placements are procedurally generated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025074153', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1668582308}
review:
The atmosphere of the game is very charming. I loved how things were tied together and scene came to life the more animals you unlock. Sound and music are great. I like the environment and idea of the game. But playing the game sometimes feel like Ishihara test (dotted pictures) at your local ophthalmologists. If you are even slightly color blind - this game is not for you.
Game is a great patience and attention trainer as well. Depending on your mood, this game can be a great way to relax after a long working day or can really piss you off.
After completing the game you may find out that you are colorblind, have ADHD and not very smart (that thing you needed to find was staring at you THE WHOLE TIME!).
I wish there were more levels. Maybe something to add via DLC? ;)
Game is made by a very small studio so sometimes there are some technical issues (you can see outside of the scene with objects ready to be activated). But a part from that it's rather good.
Game generates levels somewhat so even if you have a game guide in front of you it still might not help you.
Game help system requires you to solve a "15 puzzle". Sometimes you get a brain freeze and solving is actually harder than finding last missing item. So i had a couple of time just close it and continue searching for items instead. Not so great for the system that was supposed to help you. I also wish there were several levels of hints. First level could take you to the page where the clue is thus limiting your search scope. Next level could tell you "3/4" on the page so you know how many items are left on each page. Last hint level could actually show you the item. I think this would not be harder to implement but it would make it a bit more enjoyable to play. Current help implemented as "solution" and I would like to see it more like a "hint". Sometimes I haven't felt like giving up but I would appreciate some help in narrowing down my search area so I could still get "Found you!" dopamine kick and feel good about myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368480509', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1694663144}
review: Charming nature-themed game, where you exercise your discerning eyes by searching for camouflaged items. Each continent starts out with a simple level, and each new one you unlock becomes progressively more intricate, layered with the previous objects or animals you uncovered; be prepared to take some time towards the end! (The goal here isn't to go as fast as possible, so if you're an impatient person you WILL be frustrated!) I found this to be relatively normal difficulty - - coupled w the calming music & ambient sounds of wildlife, you'll be in for a very chill time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075620441', 'num_games_owned': 2303, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1659848135}
review:
I have had a soft spot for hidden object games/books since I was a child and would regularly get the I Spy books from the library. I think Hidden Leaves is a great addition to my experiences with this time of media. The game is pretty straightforward in its design using similar colors to hide objects in a fairly dense environment and it works great. Everything feels great to interact with and navigate through, though scrolling through areas by clicking and dragging feels a bit sluggish. 

The music for this game is minimal, but I really like it. Itâ€™s extremely relaxing and calm. And I think that is good, it makes the game very Zen.

Graphically speaking this game has gorgeous art. I love the minimalism in the number of colors and their close groups, the shapes and creatures are all well thought out and designed, and the style is distinct and beautiful. There is one major issue with it that becomes really clear once you zoom in, all of the art is compressed and quite noticeably so. It all looks like it has jpeg compression and it takes away from the cleanness of it all and comes off as sloppy. The game is 166.42 MB, you do not have to compress the art that severely.

Overall I like the game, the compression thing is a shame, but affected my enjoyment minimally. The game is well priced when on sale and is worth playing in my opinion. As you will note though I was able to complete it in less than 2 hours, so it is short even if you are of only moderate skill so keep that in mind.

review: I love hidden object games, and this one has a pretty artstyle

author: {'steamid': '76561198061207680', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1677719725}
review: Possibly the most adorable hidden object game. Each level features a single object to find in the scene, which may span multiple screens. The object has hue variants and is around the size of an emoji. The art in the scenes is beautiful and what makes this game stand out. Each scene's palette is a few related shades; this makes the game fairly colorblind-friendly, a bit of a rarity in the hidden object genre. The levels are the perfect length for a small break. The hint system keeps everything relaxing. Solving very simple sliding puzzle will show you the location of an object. You don't need to endlessly hunt for the last little flower, starfish, or acorn. The lack of words makes it accessible for younger children. All that said, the game is fairly short. Pick it up on sale or in a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045849846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1657234659}
review: Reject vision and accept division because that's how your eyes will be after this game. This is a nice and atmospheric hidden object finding game. It takes an hour or so and most of your daily eye strength to complete however. Still a nice experience I'd say.

review: Bought this game for a little over 1â‚¬ and, even if I had bought it at full price, I wouldn't have regretted it. It's a fun hidden objects game that I very much enjoyed playing (except the squirrel level (that last acorn drove me nuts to find). I don't think it could be suited for some colour-blinded people since the objects have the same colour scheme in the same area, but if anyone does try it out I hope they enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993185403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1701498299}
review: "Journey into the forest, the jungle or the depths of the deep blue sea. Find chestnuts for the pigs, a caterpillar for the crocodile or a starfish one, two three. A color-filled hidden object game from the world of animals." - Steam description. I absolutely love this game. Love the charming design, music/soundtrack. Have played during a very stressful time and found it perfectly relaxing, have replayed since and will play again. Thanks Circus Atos!

author: {'steamid': '76561198320362417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1651938940}

author: {'steamid': '76561198257614339', 'num_games_owned': 3231, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1675418416}
review:
easily one of the best hidden object games out there.

-with a great choice of colors and soundtrack makes this game a relaxing and calm experience.

-the game really makes a good use of environment without making the hidden object more visible or highlighted and won't care if it's going to be too hard for players.

-every time you finish finding the hidden object, a cute change in these environment happen and some later levels you go 
back to the older ones with the previous objects that you had to collect still there.

-the second map is I think way easier from the last levels in the first one so it's a better choice for kids if you want them to have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561199198362802', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1689018085}
review: This is a super low stakes game that I enjoyed a lot.  It's 'find the hidden thing game'.  I enjoyed the sounds, the color palette (though if you're sensitive to super saturated colors this might not be for you), the visuals are adorable.  There was one particular level that for some reason seemed way louder then the others (temperate forest).  I didn't find it too difficult, though I am currently stuck on the last ocean level trying to get through it without using the hint option.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1647452739}
review:
"Under Leaves" ist ein kindgerechtes Wimmelbild-Spiel.

Die Natur ist bunt. Jedes Tier braucht eine bestimmte Nahrung, allein sie zu finden ist nicht immer einfach. Und so helfen wir denn vielen verschiedenen Tieren - um genau zu sein sind es 28 - ihre Nahrung zu finden. 

Das Habitat eines Tieres besteht dabei aus zwei bis fÃ¼nf Screens, auf denen meist sieben bis zwÃ¶lf zu findende Dinge versteckt sind. Ein Habitat wird allerdings auch mehrfach genutzt. So leben zum Beispiel Krokodil, Schlange und ChamÃ¤leon im selben Habitat und nutzen dadurch auch dieselben Screens. 

Das Spiel ist von Aufmachung und Thematik kindgerecht ausgelegt, allerdings sollte man bedenken, daÃŸ manche Dinge wirklich gut versteckt und schwierig zu finden sind. Allerdings gibt es auch eine Hilfefunktion, bei der wir ein simples SchieberÃ¤tsel lÃ¶sen mÃ¼ssen, damit uns das nÃ¤chste Nahrungsteil angezeigt wird. 

Besonders gelungen ist die sympathische grafische Aufmachung. Die handgemalten Bilder sind nicht nur gekonnt, ihre monochrome (im Sinne von einfarbige) Ausrichtung und ihre formal grafische Struktur machen sie zu wunderschÃ¶nen Illustrationen, die jedes Kinderbuch zieren wÃ¼rden. Zudem fÃ¼hrt die Ã„sthetik auch dazu, daÃŸ das Finden der Nahrung hinreichend schwierig, aber nie unmÃ¶glich ist. Die musikalische Untermalung fÃ¼gt sich nahtlos in den gelungenen Gesamteindruck ein und rundet das Spiel geschickt ab.  

Ein einfach richtig schÃ¶ner und entspannender Titel, der das Wimmeln mal richtig Ã¤sthetisch verpackt. Da sind die immer gleiche Spielmechanik die recht kurze Spielzeit nur noch unwesentliche Begleiterscheinungen. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
8/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
7/10 Story
8/10 Grafik
8/10 Sound
7/10 Spielmechanik
6/10 Balancing
8/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Wohliges Wimmeln im Tierreich. 

[h1][b]7/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198200593627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1646423586}
review:
[h1]Making sad animals happy via shady trades![/h1]

I may not know what that croc wanted a bag of caterpillars for, but I do know that the graphics and sound design of this game are *chef's kiss*. I loved how the areas were slowly filled up with all the levels until it was just clutter everywhere. Played through it in one go, because I didn't want to stop.

Plus, I also know now that I'm apparently pretty blind when it comes to yellow and brown tones. So that's nice.

review:
Very relaxing little game. I love the music and the ambient nature sounds. And the game is just so pretty and cute.

The only negative thing I can think of is the underwater levels: the wavy moving effect makes me feel uncomfortable / mildly motion sick. I wish there was an option to turn the effect off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044721583', 'num_games_owned': 4578, 'num_reviews': 676, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1641539145}
review:
Normally, I like seeing-eye games, but this is just unfun levels of challenge. Multiple screens, random item placement, and monochromatic levels means you have no way of knowing if you've found everything on a screen. The autumn level is borderline impossible with how many leaves and sticks there are to sift through.

If you like eye-puzzles and want a challenge, give this a shot, but you will be frustrated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198835430528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1637434829}
review:
A good hidden object game with a cute design, ambient music and relaxing gameplay.
Can be finished under an hour.
Note that each level on the same continent increases in difficulty because the target objects of the previous rounds reappear there in addition to the new ones.

Schwierigkeitsgrad: Gut verteilt meiner Meinung nach. 

Fazit: Klare Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198373626575', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1633626970}
review: Under Leaves is a stunningly beautiful game. I loved the illustration style and the music. I found it very relaxing, perhaps a tiny bit too easy, but I think it is so by design. I  highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114236038', 'num_games_owned': 13205, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1638743032}
review:
Dem Grunde nach empfehlenswert und es macht SpaÃŸ - Menschen mit einer rot-grÃ¼n SehschwÃ¤che sollten unbedingt die Finger von dem Spiel lassen. Es spielt alle Farben als Objekt Suchspiel durch. Wenn die kritischen Farben kommen, wird das sehr schwierig die Objekte zu finden. 
Gut finde ich, dass man mal Diagonal, mal vertikal scrollen muss um die verstreuten Objekte zu finden. Bei den erstes geht das immer recht fix, aber dann alle, wirklich alle zu finden bedarf es zumindest bei mir einem "Doppelklick" und Einzoomen ins Bild und sehr genauem Hinsehen. Sieht einfach aus, ist es aber letztendlich nicht - zumindest bei einigen Farben. Das ist aber vielleicht auch von dem SehvermÃ¶gen abhÃ¤ngig - ich tat und tue mich recht schwer :D

author: {'steamid': '76561199103651916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1707598275}
review: I think this game is probably intended for kids, but as an adult, I found it really enjoyable. It's very relaxing, the graphics are beautiful, and the animals are super cute! The game is a satisfying length, and it has great replay value, as the objects are located in different places when you replay the game. Probably the only thing I didn't like about it was that in some levels, you have to find lizards and frogs, which was a little disturbing for me because those are larger animals that I like and think are cute; however, they're designed really simply, and it's not like you even see them being eaten, so I got over it pretty quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189168050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1630796838}
review:
very cute game! simple and sweet, a little challenging at times but overall very nice. the art is gorgeous.

also the ambiance both made me learn how to + effectively almost silenced my tinnitus. i never realized before that nature ambiance (specifically the ones used for the africa/asia maps) helps ease the ringing in my ears to barely anything. after playing for as long as my playtime is at the time of me writing the ringing is basically gone with a small exception which is phenomenal compared to what it has been for almost a year now. <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198046902881', 'num_games_owned': 1046, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1625764238}
review:
Things I've learned from this game: Apparently I'm bad with the green color spectrum. And Reds very easy for me.

I.. have mixed feelings about this game. Some levels was enjoyable and relaxing, but other levels were like pulling my nails off. Why all of these ended up being green I'm not sure why..

There is a hint button tho, which is a plus, but there is an achievement for completing the game without it. And the locations of the hidden objects are somewhat randomized so there isn't a straight-forward guide to solutions either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198409727778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1625530416}
review: Under Leaves is a game to play when you're trying to calm down or just find a little peace. It's not necessarily easy but it is soothing. There are no timers or flashing graphics--though you might get a wee bit of eyestrain if you're really concentrating or squinting while trying to find things--just nice nature sounds and quiet music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088989186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1625314547}
review: A charming game with a beautiful aesthetic. The color theme makes it unique and I've taken a couple of screenshots of me playing the game and sent them to friends because they were just so pretty! I appreciate the hint mechanic being a minigame and not just a straightforward hint, what an entertaining addition! Definitely worth the money. If there ever is a sequel I will definitely be purchasing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054324884', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1625317822}
review:
Great little hidden object game with nice, relaxing music and cute art. Some of the scenes are none too easy either and had me looking through for that last missing piece a good couple of minutes. I really enjoyed this. My only "complaint" might be that I would've wished there were even more levels.

Summary: Get it on sale perhaps as a complete playthrough really isn't that long (roughly 1.5 hours for me), but other than that a clear yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561199097843607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1624662040}
review:
A must play for those who enjoy Where's Wally books, QuickSpot (DS) or relaxing with puzzles.

True to the description, this is one of the most visually beautiful, relaxing and accessible games I've played. Zooming in (double tap) and lack of penalties for misclicks are great features. Anyone can enjoy this title, regardless of gaming ability or set up!

Though not an overly difficult game, I was often surprised at how well hidden items are, blending in both beautifully and naturally into the landscape. They aren't always where you expect them to be, which is a nice touch.

Game audio is peaceful and does a fantastic job immersing you into the scene. It's definitely a soundtrack to come back to when in need of ambient, natural sound.

Overall, this game is a lovely, relaxing experience and suitable for all. I couldn't stop thinking "Just one more level!" I had to see what stunning scene or cute change I'd be presented with next. I hope a sequel is on the cards!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025463624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1620385664}
review:
A really relaxing game. I play this with my son every now and then. We started playing games like this together when he was around four. He is ten now and still enjoys playing it with me, although we never play more than 30min at a time, because it does need a lot of patience which not every kid has.
It is really nice that there is no talking and no writing, nothing you need to read, just relaxing music and nice pictures.
There is only 2 things i dislike, the first is that you need to solve a puzzle to get a hint, which is not always easy to solve, and the other one would be, that I, and that might not be a problem for everyone, can't stand the wobbly frames in the underwater levels, makes me dizzy if I take too long for the levels!
I really like the artstyle and appreciate all the little "storys" that are implemented, flowers that start to blossom after you found seeds or all the small animals that appear after you fed their parents is really adorable.

author: {'steamid': '76561199075544150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1120, 'last_played': 1618478013}
review: Pleasant game and the sounds are very relaxing, especially with headphones on. The second map was much shorter and easier than the first - I would question why the second map is not merged with the first one. I could use this as a teacher for mindfulness. I left the game open my mistake so it shows I took 34 hours to do it, but it only takes a couple of hour

author: {'steamid': '76561198060522877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1615263295}
review: A cute fun game of finding hidden objects.  Quick play through, but easy and fun to take your mind off of work at the end of a hard day.  Recommend to anyone who likes to just relax for a fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123916740', 'num_games_owned': 1997, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1615227161}
review:
This was a cute little hidden object game (much like Where's Waldo). The graphics are interesting and nice. There wasn't a lot of levels but enough to still be enjoyable. I did also enjoy that the objects were slightly randomized within each level, so there is a tiny bit of replay value. The sounds were also very relaxing while searching for the objects. My only issue with the game is that some items were a bit hard to see, even when using the zoom option (such as the starfish for the underwater scenes). 

Overall, if you enjoy games like Hidden Folks or Hidden Through Time, you'll enjoy this game. I definitely recommend this as a good casual, relaxing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1613469816}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Un jeu d'objet cachÃ© avec de jolis dÃ©cors de type aquarelle. Il n'y a pas d'histoire, juste des tableaux avec des objets Ã  chercher, on revient dans les mÃªmes tableaux plusieurs fois pour chercher des objets identiques. C'est plutÃ´t joli, la musique d'ambiance contient des sons "nature" qui donnent un cÃ´tÃ© assez relaxant Ã  l'ensemble.

Le jeu est assez facile, mÃªme si certains niveaux sont un peu plus ardus que d'autres. La deuxiÃ¨me partie des niveaux est nettement plus courte et facile que la premiÃ¨re, d'ailleurs. Comptez entre 1h et 2h pour le terminer.

[h1]RejouabilitÃ©, achievements[/h1]

Il suffit de terminer le jeu (sans utiliser les indices) pour avoir les achievements. Aucune rejouabilitÃ©.

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Le jeu est plutÃ´t orientÃ© pour les jeunes enfants, mais reste agrÃ©able tout de mÃªme. J'ai apprÃ©ciÃ©.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente, aucun problÃ¨me rencontrÃ©.

OS: Linux Mint 19 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.
Screens : Dualscreen, 1x 4K & 1x 1920x1200, un seul screen X.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059825119', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1613430986}
review:
It's an ok hidden objects game, stationed in the world of flora and fauna. 
It has an educational value for kids because it makes you learn what food does each animal eat, and where does it live. 
The graphics (meaning the nature landscape/background of the stages ) is ok, and also is sound. 
It is relaxing but only to some extent. 1/3 of stages are a chore, because you will really have to strain your eyes in order to find all objects, which is not easy because of lack of contrast with the background. 
Also it's very short, I finished in 2 hours, 1 and a half hour I was AFK watching a movie.
So, buy if you like simplistic hidden objects game and if you don't mind straining your eyes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992238417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1613426322}
review: A chill, relaxing hidden object game with stunning, hand-painted art. Through some odd steam bug I seem to have clocked mere minutes on it while I played much longer. In any case, this is a unique-looking entry in the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198896711607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1613380531}
review: I liked the calming music and the beautiful art style. What I liked the most was that some of the puzzles were really difficult and it took a long time for me to find all of the small items - It's why I also appreciate that you can take your time with these, other strategy/puzzle games often have time limit on each puzzle therefore it's more frustrating. Definitely a game worth buying!

review: I bought the game for quick relaxation breaks during my work day, and I can see many find it fits the bill but...I found it pretty stressful, unfortunately. The color schemes are pretty but the 'objects' are so similarly colored to the background that I found myself feeling a lot of eye strain. It's probably better suited for kids or other people who don't already spend a lot of time on computers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023623749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 334, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1612221436}
review: Under Leaves - a hidden object game with cute animals, pretty nature landscapes and relaxing soundscapes. I liked it and so did my kid. It's a nice way to lull her into sleep mode, so she's relaxed enough for a bedtime story and catching those zeds. (Zzz's, not zombies, mind you!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042109472', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1873, 'last_played': 1666948681}
review: I've played this with each of my children in my lap as they reached the age where finding games are entertaining for them.  It's a beautiful, gentle game that really is aimed at children, but needs an adult to get through the more frustrating hart to find moments - that's not a bad thing!  It means that we spent the time together looking and making stories about what we were seeing.  They each had their favourite areas and animals, and the time playing together was definitely well spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072062484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1696109854}
review:
[h1]Very chill and casual[/h1]

The game delivers what it promises. Very nice graphics and a simple yet appealing concept.
Offers you a way out when you are stuck (which you will sometimes be, it's not that simple and you definitely won't blast through the levels that fast). Definitely recommend!

I do have a [b]suggestion[/b] for you:
- Please add volume settings. I had to lower the volume in my sound mixer as I was also listening to a podcast in the background and couldn't hear it through the music.

review: Short, easy, beautifully illustrated hidden object game for all ages.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988012862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 326, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1610508119}
review:
Beautiful short hidden object game.

There are 8 multi-screen biomes (backgrounds) and 29 animals (puzzles), each making you search for a handful of similarly shaped small objects (food for the animals) hidden in plain sight. The game has no words and is suitable to touch, so it's perfect for small children. [i]Double-tap to zoom in or out, swipe to switch screens.[/i] To access a hint, you need to solve a small sliding puzzle; and after you've used it, there's a short cooldown.

I found this game quite challenging: it took me 2 hours to complete using hints, to not use hints (and go for the last achievement) would take me much longer because these beautiful backgrounds are great hiding places! If you like the art and enjoy looking for hidden things, you're going to have fun with this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013494757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1609321095}

author: {'steamid': '76561199069783906', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1607121983}
review:
Under Leaves rakes up its fallen foliage to create a wholesome hidden object game that, whilst admittedly is severely targeted towards younger audiences accustomed to illustrious animal minimalism, still contains plenty of charming flora and fauna to seek.

WHAT I LIKED:
+ Wild wildlife. From the coral-infused deep blue sea, shrouded in crustaceans and majestic turtles, to the autumnal woodlands surrounded by impish foxes and hibernating hedgehogs. Each area, which are often repeated but alter the target objects for the player to find, packs plenty of charm within its gorgeously illustrated design. Likening its aesthetic appeal to a children's book. The colours within each location compliment each other profusely, utilising a plethora of shades to assist in hiding the objects which are clearly in plain sight, implementing a small but fair challenge for players of all ages. That, right there, is how a hidden object experience is truly crafted.
+ Need assistance? A hint system is on offer, meaning the brightly vivid game is accessible for all players who yearn to seek out objects but are struggling to find the last few. Using these hints will omit one achievement being gained, squarely aimed towards those completionists, but results in a casual game that is absent of punishment. The player can move on when they are happy to, perfect for younger players.

WHAT I DISLIKED:
- That leaf looks familiar. Re-using the same 4-5 locations, but only changing the objects to be found, does regrettably insert a deja vu familiarity that consequently diminishes the variance of each level. Going back to the same four underwater slides, this time searching for starfish, subconsciously reduces the time take to find them when the player already knows the layout of the location. More variety would've been appreciated, even if it meant recycling the same assets.
- A short season. With approximately 20 levels on offer, a well-seasoned object finder could complete the game in about an hour. Younger players who are new to the genre could stretch the experience to about two hours, but still feels all too short for a hidden object game. More levels or larger locations could've prolonged the game whilst sustaining player interest.

VERDICT:
6/10 sleeping foxes

author: {'steamid': '76561198041818023', 'num_games_owned': 4216, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1606992195}
review:
Under Leaves isn't one of those hidden object games where you play as some psychic detective who is trying to rescue her daughter from the evil clutches of the demon fairy king by picking up random objects off the ground and sticking them in various holes while discarding flashlights and hammers after a single use.  Not at all.

In fact, none of the objects are actually hidden, not even under leaves.  They are right there on the screen, waiting to be clicked. I know, I know.  Some fancy folks with lots of book learning might say "Well, they're hidden in plain sight."  I don't think so.

If I trip over one of my cats while making breakfast and bravely fling myself across the room so I don't land on one of the little bastards, and lay there pondering which bones are broken while the cats trot off with Jimmy Dean sausage links dangling from their greedy little mouths, I don't think "Oh, they must have been hidden in plain sight!"  No, I just didn't look down for three seconds, allowing them time to drape themselves across my feet.

So a better title for the game might have been "Small Objects That Make You Squint A Bit", but I understand why that might not be as catchy.  At least you won't have to make a mystic potion out of twelve kinds of tree sap.  I guess that counts for something.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985130407', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1606692402}
review:
This is a pure hidden object game.  There's no narrative, no characters, no overarching goals and no other game mechanics (with one exception).  You will find the barely-visible shapes as required by each scene, and that is all you will do in Under Leaves.

This gameâ€™s art style, with its simple shapes, limited color palette and often cluttered scenes, creates a lot of opportunity for the game developers to place objects in places that are almost impossible to see.  And believe me, they definitely take those opportunities.

I sometimes used the hint system to find the elusive one or two remaining objects in a scene before Iâ€™d spent so much time that frustration began to set in.  The hint system charges after a few seconds, and to get the hint you have to solve one of my absolute nemesis in puzzle games: a sliding tile puzzle!  Luckily the tiles donâ€™t seem to be fully randomized and can usually be solved in just a few moves.  That I can deal with.  But you have to complete the entire game without using any hints to get the ultimate achievement, so I missed earning a perfect game.

I went through all of the game's twenty-nine scenes in about ninety minutes.  Not bad for $1.25 on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198162381766', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1604060923}
review:
questo gioco Ã¨ un scova gli oggetti nascosti nell'ambiente. Lo scopo del gioco Ã¨ aiutare i vari animali a trovare le loro "prede" che siano lumache, ghiande o altro, in ogni ambiente ne dovrete trovare tot che si mimetizzano abbastanza bene nello scenario. Scenario composto dalle 2 alle 5 schermate totali. Sia la musica che la mancanza di un limite temporale, fa si che questo gioco si propone di far rilassare il giocatore mentre cerca gli oggetti. Per non parlare che dopo pochi secondi c'e la possibilitÃ  di chiedere l'aiuto del gioco, tramite l'icona a punto interrogativo, che vi segnalerÃ  l'ubicazione di uno degli oggetti. Questo gioco Ã¨ diviso in due macro aree, l'europa con america e africa, poi viene l'asia con l'australia. Per un totale di 28 animali diversi. La prima macro area Ã¨ la piÃ¹ difficile sia per le dimensioni dei livelli che per la mimetizzazione delle "prede". La seconda area Ã¨ molto piÃ¹ facile.

Consiglio questo gioco solo come passatempo rilassante, magari scontato un pÃ² di piÃ¹ del quasi 30%. ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198009752238', 'num_games_owned': 953, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1601827802}
review:
Under Leaves  is one of those great wind down games. Had a long day or just need something to calm you down? This game is perfect for it. Gourgeous art of animals and all you have to do is find small hidden objects in the pictures. What's cool is that each stage you do adds to the picture and you will come back to it later to find more hidden objects.

This game is great for both kids and adults. I think my only concern for this game is that it doesn't have a hint system. When you have stages where you have to find 13 objects and you only find 12, that very last one can be annoying since it's keeping you from advancing to the next level. 

Final verdict? Pick this up if you;re looking for a relaxing game or a fun hidden object game. I think this is perfect for your library. Thanks for reading!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044264303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1572901258}

author: {'steamid': '76561199064318384', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1594696160}
review: So here's the thing. It was fun & quite frustrating at times... but way too short imo. Definitely inexpensive though, so I'm not too unhappy with the purchase. Hopefully they add more to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230311952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1594304890}
review: This game really encourages you to take a deep breath and relax. You will find more of the hidden items in each scene if you just sit back and calmly scan the lovely art with a thoughtful eye. At first I wasn't very chill and was approaching it with a lot of energy and alertness, but it seemed as if that actually made it harder. The way pieces blend into the scenery seems to make you want to slow down and then, like I said, everything slowly reveals itself. I would recommend this as a way to decompress at the end of a rough day. Once you reach the end, just put it aside long enough for you to not quite remember ever map and then reset it to enjoy all over again. I finished it in two sessions and I plan to let it sit in the back of my library for at least a week or so before utilizing it again as a method of de-stressing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026357212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1596940155}
review: It's definitely not a super challenging game, but the insanely beautiful art makes you not even care. The music is so relaxing and finding each new animal is delightful. Will you spend a ton of time and be really challenged by this game? No. Will you love every second you spend in this watercolor world? Definitely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061225352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1593625114}
review:
This game is fantastically frustrating. It's full of beautiful, colourful artwork as well as sometimes relaxing gameplay. 

A lovely game for slightly older children and people who aren't colour blind, as the randomised object locations and colour merging can make it pretty difficult, especially when trying to get the Under Leaves achievement.

Once you get the hang of it, you start to remember locations and areas where objects are and it's very enjoyable. I absolutely recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280547374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1588846311}
review:
This game consists of finding hidden objects in wildlife scenes.  As others have said, what you see is what you get.  If you enjoy pure object-hunting then you're likely to enjoy this.

The environments are very beautifully drawn and there's relaxing ambient sound.  The objects you're looking for are very tiny and blend very closely into the background, so I'm not sure this really is a game for children unless they're extraordinarily patient.  However, there is a forgiving hint system where you can solve a quick and easy sliding puzzle in exchange for locating one item.  

Staring unblinkingly at the screen to find these tiny objects does play havoc with your eyes, so I find I can't play for very long at once, but the game is enjoyable and relaxing in short stints.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198056921937', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2243, 'last_played': 1577555881}
review:
I liked it and hated it. Also, my hours don't reflect my playtime LOL, I left it open for most of the time without realizing (including overnight), I didn't take THAT long to find everything..

Pros: Simple game, really nice artwork, cute, nice soothing nature sounds, different environments to look at, easy 100% achievements.

Cons: Frustrating because it took me forever to get all the hidden objects in most of the levels. (Maybe I'm just bad at this...) The point is that the objects you collect blend in super well with the environment colors. I thought this game was supposed to be relaxing and I got super frustrated! But, it gets WAY EASIER at the end (or, second part) for some reason, which was a breeze and a phew for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068169042', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1575547624}
review:
It is cute beautiful HO game. There is no story and developers use only HO esence as an elementary part of the game. But they take advantage of that choice very well. Realy good simplified artwork on maybe a little naive but a high artistic level. It is easy in the beginning. Using shades of one type of colour makes the game more difficult. On top of that the game is getting harder as objects remain in screens when comming to the area again. Finishing the task give you some animation as a reward. Nice concept. I would appreciate some basic educational information, because item is usually strongly connected with animal that requested it. Typically the food. (They used this idea strongly in their next game Little MouseÂ´s Encyclopedia.) I did not like only colours in Africa, I think, it was too bright. I agree with some comments that the game is a kind of test of colour-blindness. Not sure it was an intent. The game looks like it is for children but I am not sure. There are cute animals and easy nature. The monotone shades of some colours could be boring after a while. As for me it was relaxing and it includes the simply music that underlines sounds of the nature. Yes I finally got to the end without any hint.
My recomendation is surely YES in HO indie category. Game made with heart and enthusiasm.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156475266', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1575417152}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034248057', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1574843679}
review:
The game is quite simple and relaxing. Not very challenging, though a few hidden objects may stump you for a moment.
Relaxing ambiance with nature sounds and subtle intermittent music.
Beautiful artwork and aesthetic.
After a certain point the game grants a hint - which allows you to solve a simple slider puzzle to show you a hidden object.
Tip - Double clicking allows you to zoom in and out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073941274', 'num_games_owned': 3149, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1574286134}
review:
[b]Beautiful relaxing Hidden Object Game[/b]

A great HOG with a beautiful art style and aesthetic.  I did not care for the background noise/music, so I played with my sound off.  The puzzles are good and some can be quite challenging (if you don't use any hints).  Its nice that the puzzles are randomized so you can't just look up screenshots of solutions. Achievements are also straight-forward, one achievement for each puzzle and one for never using any hints.

[i]Excellent Hidden Object Game with some challenge if you don't use hints![/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198026121637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1574052801}
review: This game is adorable and super relaxing. It feels like a really beautiful children's book and the nature sounds are great if you want to zen out and look for acorns or berries to feed your animal friends. It's a short play through - probably 45 minutes to an hour and a half depending on your play style. I loved it and I can see myself replaying it, after some time has passed, when I want to zone out after work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140746888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1570320923}
review: This game was a gift from my boyfriend. Its super cute and simple! The music is really relaxing. Some of the items were challenging to find so it's a good game for any age even though it is definetly geared more towards children as there is no reading needed of any kind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307323681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1632338142}
review: Very pleasingly minimal. No troubles to overcome. No bugs. I wish it were longer, but it's a fair amount of game for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030756861', 'num_games_owned': 948, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1519719568}
review:
A nice but very simplistic HOG, that would best be suited for the pre-13 year old crowd. None the less however, if you are an adult and just want to relax, this is the game for you. 

The scenes are aesthetically pleasing and every scene is based on different areas of the world, with the animals to match. Each scene has a number of objects to find, that are hidden decently well in the underbrush and vegetation. To find the objects you will also have to "scroll" in the scenes, the number of panels in a scene varies. I will say each scene does have 1-3 extremely well hidden items and a few of the boards had me stumped for awhile. There is also no rush to find the hidden objects as their are no timers.

The game doesn't last very long, mostly depending upon your skill. And like I said I believe that younger people under the age of 13 would get the most bang for their buck on this one.  And it's easy to 100% the game as well, based on the difficulty. I do advise to get this game on sale.  I rate this 7/10 for children and 4 out of 10 for adults.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032596719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1567889767}
review: Very simple, relaxing and aesthetically pleasing game.  Fair warning:  the monochrome, the walls of patterns and the new age music will put you to sleep if you play this too late in the day.  That said, there are a few tough scenes to find all the hidden objects, but once your eye is trained for that pattern, you tend to pick them out pretty quickly.  Not a long game, but justifies the price they ask.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281524760', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1561984636}
review:
This is going to be a very short review, sorry (I am a man of few words).

First things first: this game is pretty cute.
+ I like the artstyle. It is simple but appealing, and fits this type of game in my opinion.
+ The music is also very soothing.
+ The mix of those two things creates an overall peaceful ambiance.
With this atmosphere, it's extremely difficult to rage when you don't find one of the items.

Two downsides to this game:
- This is kind of subjective, but it is pretty short considering you can earn cards. (I'm pretty sure Steam only awards the first card after two hours, meaning you'll have to go through multiple playthroughs even if you don't want it).
- I really don't recommend playing if you have trouble telling similar colors apart. Some levels will be the death of you

Is it me or are the couple levels on the blue map a tad easier? Regardless, they're as enjoyable as the others and have nice scenery.

TL;DR:
Unless, as I mentioned above, you suffer from any form of color blindness or similar, I recommend playing this. I think it's worth its price. If you are a patient person, bonus points.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101454711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1582455563}
review:
[h1]About the game :[/h1]

Finding the hidden objects in different environments.

[h1]What I like :[/h1]

Visual style - Simple and nice art style

Gameplay - Finding the objective items can be easy but also challenging in some levels.

Sound : Relaxing ambient sound and going well with the artwork.

[h1]What I dislike :[/h1]

Playtime - Sometimes the objects are too well blended with the environment which will take time to find it.

[h1]Conclusion :[/h1]

The game is nice and the artwork is cute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036240160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1561581515}
review:
Very simple and quick game, not the most challenging hidden object game either (though difficulty does increase), yet still a worthy game and the developers deserve recognition for it. Hopefully they'll do more games like this at some point, maybe bigger ones!

Despite the length of the game, it still was quite entertaining and it was beautifully made with cute alluring visuals and relaxing nature ambience sounds. I had my fun observing the artwork as I played.

I'd also like to add that this adorable and sweet game is great to play along with children of any age and spend some quality time with them!

author: {'steamid': '76561198218646531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1561636493}
review:
The game holds what it promises. It's really calming and I just love the artstyle of it. The sounds of nature and music give it such a good vibe.
I definitely recommend it even tho I keep struggling with some levels. It's good for it's prize but I wouldn't charge more. Got it on the sale with 50% off.

I started the game with the goal of not using a single clue, because I wanted to get every achievement. Some levels are really really easy, especially those on the blue map. I basically solved each of them in 1-3 minutes. But the autumn map (with the deer, hedgehog and squirrel for example) is really hard. I end up not finding the last few ones and its so frustrating because there's not a single guide or walkthrough that goes that far. 

So yeah, if you're determined to get the achievement of not using a single clue, it'll be hard. But otherwise, just enjoy it, don't get too hard on yourself, you can do it.


Edit: I gave up on the squirrel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234516860', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1561597316}
review:
NOT SUITABLE FOR COLOUR BLIND PEOPLE.
More challenging than I expected.

Pros:
- Double clicking the screen will zoom in.
- Hint button is available, and requires you to do a block-puzzle each time you want a hint.

Cons:
- Colours are extremely similar. This makes it challenging, but also means that if you have colour blindness the game may be impossible for you.
- If you get stuck on one level you can't really go and play another one. It seems they have to be done in order.

Other:
- The levels start out very easy, and progress in difficulty as you complete levels. This is partially due to the fact that every time you complete a level, it adds things to the scene, so next time a level is in that particular scene, you have extra things to contend with. The animals you already sorted out remain there, and the items you had to look for previously remain there, meaning that you're looking for something new, amoung items you were desperately searching for mere minutes ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193589490', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1549636290}
review:
[i]Under Leaves[/i] ist ein Suchspiel, welches uns in die Tierwelt entfÃ¼hrt und besonders durch seine schÃ¶nen Illustrationen in Wasserfarbengrafik und der beruhigenden AtmosphÃ¤re besticht.

Das Spiel ist so gestaltet, dass es jede Altersgruppe anspricht. Auch kleine Kinder dÃ¼rften damit kein Problem haben, da man fÃ¼r das Spiel nicht lesen kÃ¶nnen muss. FÃ¼r die Ã„lteren bzw. Kindgebliebenden unter uns ist das Spiel durch seine beruhigende Hintergrundmusik und angenehmen Soundeffekte sowie der fÃ¼r die Augen sehr entspannenden Farbgebung zusammen mit den unaufgeregten Animationen perfekt fÃ¼r den Ausklang eines harten Arbeitstages oder um etwas kleines Nebenbei zu haben, wenn man z.B. einen Podcast hÃ¶rt.

Eine richtige Handlung gibt es nicht aber in den meisten FÃ¤llen suchen wir fÃ¼r die verschiedensten Tiere ihre Nahrung. Dabei wechseln sich die Level in angenehmen AbstÃ¤nden ab, so dass man erst im Wald ist, dann ins Meer abtaucht nur um dann in der Savanne weiter zu machen. Auch wenn sich die Gebiete wiederholen, bietet das Spiel durch neu hinzugefÃ¼gte Tiere genug Abwechslung und der Schwierigkeitsgrad wird stetig aber nicht zu sehr erhÃ¶ht.

Zu schwer wird es auf jeden Fall nie. Falls man doch mal Schwierigkeiten mit dem Finden einer Sache hat, gibt es eine Zoomfunktion oder man kann sich direkt fÃ¼r einen Hinweis entscheiden. Dieser muss allerdings durch ein Schiebe-Minispiel freigeschaltet werden. So kann man das Hilfesystem nicht so einfach missbrauchen. AuÃŸerdem positiv ist, dass es einen gewissen Wiederspielwert gibt, da sich die zu suchenden Sachen bei jedem neuen Durchgang immer an einem anderen Ort befinden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344904307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1552822300}
review: I love hidden object games and can spend hours playing this kind of games. Under Leaves is about finding hidden objects in a big scene. The game has great wallpapers and also the main theme is good. It's about animals like foxes, crocodiles, flamingos, turtles and parrots. They live in different biomes and always ask for fish, worms or butterflies to search for. The game is more suitable for professional players and you can spend up to an hour in some scenes. The music and the sounds are ambient which contributes to a very good mood. This is supported by the sound of animals. The game can be used to recover from a stressful day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040527801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1560443829}
review: The game is cute, but this is not enough, it will make your eyeballs bleed in order to find the yellow leaf on the yellowish background.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074845294', 'num_games_owned': 1302, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1560191885}
review: This might a mobile port, but I loved it. At first I thought this would be way to easy even for a distraction game, which this is. But after a few levels it became really challenging and a bit frustrating at times as well. If you get it on sale, do not hesitate. Very enjoyeable two hours I had with this one. If you like hidden object games and are in no mood or time for an action-packed game, play this one. Definitely recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198260652940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1680445598}
review: The beautiful artwork and great ambient sound make this quite a relaxing game. Also, it's kids-approved: my niece (7) and nephew (4) [b]love[/b] "Under Leaves"!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198199045323', 'num_games_owned': 6327, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1559500532}
review:
Under Leaves is a hidden Object game pure and simple. On a map of the world you are given many different locations, each location is a different stage to complete all related to different animals indigenous to the location on the map. Each stage is beautifully crafted. A real work of love! The fact that each level has a certain color scheme give it a certain style but also makes it surprisingly challenging, just enough to keep my interest through the whole game. 

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*]For those who likes the extra challenge, there's 29 achievements. One for each stage and one extra for finishing the game without help.
[*]Each stage is beautifully crafted, you can tell that a lot of work and thought went into each one. A real work of art!
[*]Each stage is random, the objects you have to find are never in the same spot, so you can replay it indefinitely.
[*]The objects are not so easy to find so it's a very good challenge for HOG veterans.
[*]Enough content to keep you busy for about 2-3 hours.
[*]Nice soothing music that fits well with the game
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*]Honestly I'm having a hard time finding any cons to this game, the only [i]warning[/i] I might give is don't be fooled by the cute and light graphics, this game can be very hard. If you're not into HOG maybe start by something easier. As seen in the screenshots, the style and monochromatic color scheme can make it hard to find the hidden objects.
[/list]

A cute and well thought out hidden objects game that will keep you entertain for several hours. If you like puzzle and HOG, this game is a must have. It is certainly well worth the small price tag of 5$.

review: Love this game for myself as well as for the grandchildren.  And the devs are amazing!  They are always adding more things.  This is so special as a lot of developers drop their games almost as soon as the game comes out.  Bought this last year or so and happened to go back for a look for the grandkids - and saw that several things have been added so played a couple last night and the game is so improved.  Highly recommend this game.

review:
Un petit jeu d'objets cachÃ©s charmant et reposant. 

Under Leaves propose d'observer quelques petits coins de nature visuellement tout doux, tout en nuances, avec des animations discrÃ¨tes et des bruitages adaptÃ©s entremÃªlÃ©s Ã  quelques notes d'une musique non envahissante. Une parenthÃ¨se un peu naÃ¯ve, un peu touchante pendant laquelle il nous faudra satisfaire les requÃªtes des divers occupants des lieux qui nous demanderont, qui du poisson, qui des insectes, qui des feuilles... et nous gratifieront en rÃ©compense d'une petite animation. 

Il y a peu de tableaux mais c'est plutÃ´t sympa quand on revient dessus, on est plus attentif Ã  tous les "objets" que l'on a cherchÃ© prÃ©cÃ©demment et le tableau parait subjectivement de plus en plus riche. 

Je l'ai trouvÃ© plus relevÃ© et j'y ai mis plus de temps que ce que me laissaient supposer les Ã©valuations, pas loin de 4h. Ma vue commence a accuser son age sur les faibles contrastes et basse luminositÃ© et sur ce type de recherche d'objets dans leur environnement naturel rendu en variations de teintes tout en douceur, je suis passÃ© au fil des tableaux de "Hop ! Hop ! Hop ! Je vous tiens." Ã  "Mince, oÃ¹ se cache le dernier ?" puis Ã  "Mais, euh, j'aimerais bien en trouver un pour voir Ã  quoi Ã§a ressemble !". Pas de fatigue visuelle pour autant, j'ai pu consommer Under Leaves sans modÃ©ration.

Au final j'ai Ã©prouvÃ© beaucoup plus de difficultÃ© qu'avec la majoritÃ© des jeux d'objets cachÃ©s qui nous noient sous un bric-Ã -brac improbable d'objets hÃ©tÃ©roclites aux couleurs mal assorties. LÃ  oÃ¹ beaucoup joue la confusion, Under leaves joue la dissimulation. Et c'Ã©tait ma foi un moment fort agrÃ©able.

Bon allez, je vais me forcer Ã  trouver un ou deux points faibles. 
Pour la plupart des joueurs, Under Leaves aura une trÃ¨s courte durÃ©e. Les autres qui comme moi y passeront plus de temps que prÃ©vu, sentiront peut-Ãªtre le manque de relief de sa bande son. A force d'Ãªtre trop plat, je trouve que le bruitage perd en naturel, il manque de temps en temps ce piaf qui gazouile plus fort que les copains ou cette bestiole invisible dans les buissons qui fait soudain un raffut d'enfer en se grattant.
