author: {'steamid': '76561198287805607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1552251370}
review:
Itâ€™s cute, simple and easily accessible to everyone. Have anxiety? Are you a multitasker or someone looking for a time waster? Have kids who like cute animals and non-challenging gameplay? This is it. Under Leaves is a hidden object â€œpuzzleâ€-esque game where an animal needs your help! Theyâ€™ll ask you to find them a certain number of something and itâ€™s up to you to roam through that section of nature looking for it. Reminded me of playing Whereâ€™s Waldo as a kid, but this time with a unique, very pretty artstyle and cute animals. After you help an animal, itâ€™ll offer some resolution, usually you were finding food for it to give to its children, who only appear and start playing around the area once youâ€™ve helped their parent out. It covers animals from all different locations as well, places underwater, normal woods, swampy places and rainforests, etc and lots of animals in each one. 

The achievements are for completing each animals tasks, and for doing so without any hints. The hint option was actually pretty interesting itself, since you donâ€™t just get a hint, you have to solve a sliding puzzle to be allowed to get a hint each time. That might be a little annoying for children to deal with, but I donâ€™t think the sliding puzzle is ever THAT bad. The objects also are randomly in spots, so if you want to play this game again, you can! They wonâ€™t be where you last found them. 

I played through this while listening to podcasts not to long ago,  and only picked this gem up for that reason--I love multitasking and casual, no-nonsense games like this are great for people who just want to relax and turn most of your mind off. I got this on sale, as per usual, and can recommend it to anyone considering this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090934830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1536948785}
review: A beautiful game where you can really relax. Once I started doing that, I just could not stop. It's a lot of fun and the color blasts really keep you happy. With the right music in the background, the whole game becomes a wonderful pastime. For friends of the hidden object genre highly recommended - patience, a keen eye and peace are indispensable! The difficulty increases noticeably, a real challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335224592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1551779380}
review:
Much can be, and has been, said about the beautiful art and soothing music of Under Leaves. What makes this game special to me, however, is like another favorite of mine, Ruya, it's also a strong contender for a game that is friendly towards people with any sort of mental health problems like anxiety and depression, as well as ADHD, or anyone on the spectrum. 

My only gripe is the inability to adjust volume in game, something I've always found very valuable and wish was something that could maybe be added into a small patch in the future. 

The focus on animal themes was endearing, and also makes this a family friendly game, and with them zoom function and if you use the help even little kids could find most the hidden objects. Only thing I found that may be a big disturbing for very impressionable/very sensitive young children may be the later expansion's second-to-last map has you searching for turtles which is the food for a stork. If kids make that connection it can feel a bit grisly. Otherwise, there's zero problems even for very young child.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052730657', 'num_games_owned': 1039, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1551281474}
review:
Took me some time to finish this one. Great hidden objects game, first chapter got me sometimes with just 1 object missing, second one was a bit easier, but still fun to complete.
Bought it in sale, absolute recommendation, maybe also for full price if you're into this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1593553896}
review:
This is more buyer information than a "recommendation." The game does exactly what it says, by providing a relaxing hidden object game. What might not be obvious is how the gameplay is so completely simple. There are no layers, story, or even a settings menu.

There is just a simple shape that must be found repeatedly in a painted picture. There's actually no reason this even needs to be done on a computer, except to get a musical chime when the shape is clicked. This game runs through the Unity Game Engine, and I played through a lot of this short game in ten minutes, on an ubuntu linux computer. I might recommend this game when available for less than a dollar, but then maybe not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198877575018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1549644815}
review:
A nice, relaxing game. It has great artwork, which makes it really stand out from other hidden object games. I also like the fact the hints aren't so easy to get.
I highly recommend it, I just wish there were even more levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122389049', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1551454680}
review:
Very nice stylish a little hidden object game.

There is no story, you just need to feed the animals by finding few copies of the same item on the cluttered background.
The biggest difficulty is that the items and the background have the same color scheme.
But overall the game is very simple and relaxing.

I like HOG games (like this one) where objects you need to find are the natural part of the picture instead of some random pile of things that disconnected from the environment.

It's not as complex and detailed as Morphopolis game but still nicely done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037559580', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1543995546}
review:
Beautiful art. I'd not played a hidden objects game in several years before purchasing this one and I have to say, it was far more enjoyable than I'd thought. The visuals are gorgeous and the ambient sounds coupled with sparce music make for a very relaxing experience. I played through twice, once over several days after stressful times at work and a second time to see how quickly I could do it without using the help function.

As a note, you can zoom in by double clicking! I didn't realize until midway through my first playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158004807', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1543803832}
review: I found this game to be fun and relaxing. The artwork and music are very nice. Searching for the hidden objects is often very challenging. I finished the two zones of the game in just over two hours. It seems that the developers have been adding new scenes to hunt, so that's cool. Recommended if you like hidden object puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175973937', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1543220120}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961734538', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 337, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1543041255}
review:
Under Leaves is a fine, relaxing little hidden object game. I'm not really a connoisseur of the genre, since i basically only play them as a way to soothe a hangover, but it seems like a decent enough contribution. I like that (on the regular map at least) the food all appears in places that you would expect it to be in real life - e.g. acorns under the oak tree. That doesn't hold true for the bonus levels, but they feel more like a speed run anyway.

The one disappointing thing about this game is that nothing happens if you click and you miss. Something really great about Hidden Folks (for example) is that there is a tiny bit of interactivity on every click, which helps to keep it a bit interesting.

One big plus is the music. Some of the levels have barely-there ambient nature sounds, but the Africa level in particular has some subtle but effective world music. I would love to have heard a bit more of that... But this is a short game so oh well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068347336', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1558760442}
review: A cute, mildly challenging hidden object game where you find food for the local wildlife. Lovely art. Easy to force if you just get plain stuck on the last one or two objects, which may happen a few times, especially on the larger stages. It's obvious it was a mobile game/built for mobile. The movement between screens would feel smoother with a swiping motion. Warning: you may get some motion sickness between the screen transitions and the water stages if you're succeptible to it. Can be 100%ed in 2 hours, give or take.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076472891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1543019195}
review: What a beautiful, gentle, charming game. If you're looking for something your kids can play, this game is perfect! No reading required. For older kids, it could be used to learn about animals and their habitats. Simple but still challenging enough to require attention to detail!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993419334', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1542596729}
review:
There isn't much to say about Under Leaves that can't be said with a simple screenshot. It's a Hidden Object game in the purest sense of the world, as there is no real story and no other purpose than collecting the specific objects that you are assigned in each level. The game is beautiful, it has nice nature sounds accompaning the experience and while there is some challenge, it's more of a relaxing experience than anything else.

There are a couple of things I'll note that might be of importance in considering a purchase: firstly, the levels do repeat, meaning that the backgrounds aren't unique to each level. Currently, there are 28 different levels across 9 backgrounds (unless I miscounted), with each level being an animal and a new set of things. The result is that the difficulty increases naturally, as each set of things stay in the environment, adding to the clutter of the game. Secondly, there is a simple hint system that entails a minigame in form of a sliding puzzle. I really liked this idea in Lumino City, and I like it here as well, even though it could've been a bit harder. Thirdly, a few of the levels are part of a free update that the devs put out and while nice, they're also a lot easier than the base ones. 

To conclude, there is nothing wrong with this game. It is literally a what-you-see-is-what-you-get-situation. If you like the art and enjoy relaxing games (or you want something to play while listening to a podcast or something), this is worth playing. If that's not your jam, there is nothing else to capture you here. Either an easy purchase, or an easy pass; for me, it would be the former.

author: {'steamid': '76561198818601272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1539448790}
review: A very short game featuring cute critters in painterly, monochromatic backgrounds. Under Leaves is great for when you need a moment to unwind. While not particularly challenging and certainly never frustrating, finding the tiny details hidden among the scenery still requires focus. I think that comfortable middle ground is what makes this game so relaxing. I'd recommend it to hidden object fans and anyone looking for a short, relaxed game to take their mind off things for a little while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024865875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1534301629}
review:
I love playing hidden object games, looking for clues and solving puzzles.  I thought that "Under Leaves" would be a standard hidden object game.  It's not.  Instead of following a story line and trying to save time/the world/your family/the universe, you find objects for animals.  Each animals wants you to search through 2 or more connected pages to find plants, animals, acorns, sea anemones,...  It varies according to the animal's environment.  

And although it wasn't what I expected, I found that I loved playing this game.  Some of the brown/yellow/orange areas proved to be more difficult (and no, I don't know why I had more trouble with certain background colors).  But I enjoyed myself anyway.  

I recommend this to everyone who likes the hidden object aspect of puzzle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992906798', 'num_games_owned': 13408, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1534033590}
review: Beautiful, simple and relaxing hidden object game. It is the perfect game to help you unwind after a long day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178496574', 'num_games_owned': 813, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1533416048}
review: Under Leaves is a delightful hidden-object game with an aesthetic ripped straight from a children's book. The scenes are usually fairly easy to play through, and if you get stuck, you can access hints after completing a sliding block puzzle. The audio in the game, ambient music combined with sounds of wildlife, helps to provide a relaxing atmosphere. Overall, the game is not particularly difficult or complex, but it doesn't really need to be. It's just a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198806991069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1534998311}
review: Under leaves is super fun, super relaxing, and super easy. Its just the sort of game you want to play on a lazy afternoon while drinking a cup of tea. The artwork is pleasant and the soundtrack is calming. I was a little worried at first that the color sceme might be difficult for colorblind people (as I have a friend who is colorblind) but the shapes of the objects make up for that so they can still play. If you are already really great at hidden object games this might be too easy for you, but I've been in ones before where it's taken me hours to find one last thing. This game isn't like that at all. It doesn't muck about with other kinds of puzzles either. Just hidden objects. Would recommend for all ages.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052332539', 'num_games_owned': 976, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1538320497}
review:
[h1]*Under Leaves* - Ein farbenfrohes Suchspiel fÃ¼r alle Altersklassen[/h1]

Ihr mÃ¶gt Suchspiele? Ihr mÃ¶gt die Natur, schÃ¶ne Bilder und eine entspannte Soundkulisse? Dann seid ihr hier genau richtig! 

In schÃ¶n gemalten Szenerien mit sehr gelungener Hintergrundmusik bzw. GerÃ¤uschkulisse begebt ihr euch in verschiedenen Habitaten auf die Suche nach Futter fÃ¼r die Tiere. Abwechselnd betretet ihr den Dschungel, die Unterwasserwelt, den heimischen Wald oder die Savanne. Habt ihr fÃ¼r ein Tier alle gewÃ¼nschten Dinge wie zum Beispiel Kastanien, Schnecken, Seesterne oder Schmetterlinge gefunden, gibt es einen kleinen Ãœberraschungseffekt, indem sich die Szenerie leicht verÃ¤ndert (Blumen blÃ¼hen auf, bunte Fische erscheinen etc.). Diese Effekte bleiben auch bei weiterem Betreten der einzelnen Welten erhalten und gestalten so die einzelnen LebensrÃ¤ume immer lebendiger.

Nun denkt man vielleicht, das ganze wÃ¤re simpel. Auch mir ging das am Anfang so. Nach den ersten Suchbildern dachte ich mir, dass es wohl nur etwas fÃ¼r Kinder ist. Aber das tÃ¤uscht. Mit jedem weiteren Tier nimmt auch die Herausforderung zu. Die Schwierigkeit besteht darin, dass die gesuchten Objekte sich in genau der gleichen Farbgebung wie ihre Umgebung bewegen. So ist zum Beispiel die Unterwasserwelt komplett in verschiedenen BlautÃ¶nen gestaltet und die gesuchten Fische besitzen eben diese Farbgebung. Dadurch sind sie oft so gut wie gar nicht von ihrer Umwelt zu unterscheiden und man braucht wirklich ein gutes Auge und ein wenig Geduld. Aber keine Angst. Es gibt einen Hilfemodus, sollte man einmal nicht weiterkommen. Allerdings schafft man dann die 100% bei den Erfolgen nicht mehr. Hier ist die Voraussetzung, das komplette Spiel ohne Hilfe zu schaffen.

Ich persÃ¶nlich mag solche kleinen Spiele unheimlich gerne, sind sie doch immer wieder eine erfrischende Abwechslung zu den restlichen "Standardspielen". Deshalb von mir eine klare Empfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198383511642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1532488924}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077378264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1532238559}
review:
Under Leaves is a beautiful hidden object game.  I really enjoyed the whole experience and I highly recommend it.  I give this game 8 out of 10 and look forward to additional content. 

The game consists of visiting natural habitat locations and looking for items that blend into the background.  Each level has a theme animal and your goal is to locate food items for that animal.  Something interesting always happens when you complete a level. 
[list]
[*]The artwork is terrific.  The locations are animated, trees sway in the wind, and baby animals frolic distracting you from your searching.
[*]The music is pleasant and soothing.
[*]The game is short - it will take you about two hours to complete it.
[*]Each level yields a Steam achievement upon completion.
[*]Hints are available but there is an achievement for completing the game without hints.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019007179', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1530996281}
review:
This is a basic hidden object game without any storytelling. You get bubbles with pictures in them showing objects that you need to find and collect, guiding you through the game's beautiful world. The graphics are reason enough to purchase this game, in my opinion!

The game provides a calm atmosphere with natural sounds and small movements in each of the hidden object scenes. It's a short game and can look simple. But due to the amazing color contrasts in the artwork, there are many good places to camouflage the objects. The game takes you into the surrounding environment several times, collecting new things. Something that in some cases makes it extra hard to remember what to actually look for this time. Keep in mind that it is possible to achieve this achievement "Play through the game without using the help". So good luck and use your eyes well!

Tip: You can zoom in to the scenes to browse through the leaves on the ground better, or look closer to the ocean floor to find the little stones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089733694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1661556605}
review: Beautiful artwork and graphics! A great way to keep the mind sharp by finding designated objects for each animal! Would be a great game for kids who are just starting to enter into the video game worlds and trying to develope their pointer and click gaming skills. Would also recommend playing this game tom help relieve stress or tension. Soothing music and pleasing colors. Highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026007314', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1530573221}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078588585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 144, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1711314127}
review:
The game was a bit short (but less so than I first thought), but the artwork si absolutely gorgeous. It's a really cute small game, and the concept is very simple to understand, but still it was sometimes quite challenging to find the objects! 
I like that the help makes you work for it (although that's not necessarily my kind of puzzle). 
Overall a great, relaxing hour or two.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418985084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1530348104}
review:
Really beautiful game! Right away fell in love with the amazing watercolor style and cute drawings of the game.  The music was really good too, relaxing tunes mixed with natural sounds.
My first time I used hints so it wasn't that difficult, but it got quite challenging when I decided to get the "Under Leaves" achievement. I got frustrated sometimes because I couln't see the objects even with them been in front of me, specially in the Squirrel and Fox levels. 
What I really liked is that the objects you have to find are positioned in places that kind of make sence. Like if you are looking for a flying creature you'll find more of them on top of trees, or any seed would be on the ground or hanging around the branches of a tree. 
Over all, a really good purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067374907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1555869266}
review:
Very pretty and calming game.  The art is stunning and the atmosphere created was much more relaxing than most hidden object games.

I would love to see wallpapers of some of the levels too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079029714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1530317219}
review: Fun, jump-right-in hidden-object game with a wonderful children's-book art style and animal theme.  Starts off fairly easy, but gets harder, especially as you search previous levels for new objects and have to "tune out" previous stage goals ("hey, there's a starfish... no, wait, I'm not looking for starfish this time..." is something I found myself thinking more than a few times!)  Not a very long game, but I'll keep it installed for the next time someone asks to play a quick fun game on my computer, or someone's kids need to be entertained for an hour or two.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074169975', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 694, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1530212834}
review: This hidden object is very easy at first, but it becomes more difficult and interesting later. Beautiful and relaxing, it's better to get it at discount price, because it's short, even without using the help.

author: {'steamid': '76561198830027413', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1626237496}
review: I just finished Under Leaves. I was drawn to the game because of the art style.. it's simply gorgeous. The main world levels started to get a little tricky, but I was determined to not use any hints. The hardest level for me was the red fox. I beat the entire game in 2.4 hours, but I picked it up in the summer sale at 2.49$ so I'm not worried about the length. It is a great game to relax to, friendly for all ages.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200852919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1690795687}
review:
Ich habe mir "Under Leaves" im Summer Sale gekauft.
Anfangs war ich ein wenig skeptisch, dass es vielleicht zu leicht sein kÃ¶nnte, aber das habe ich mittlerweile verworfen.

In dem Spiel geht es um Folgendes:
Ein Tier sagt dem Spieler, was es gern hÃ¤tte (z. B. ein Wildschwein will 7 Kastanien). Dieses muss man nun in dem Bilder (bzw. den verschiedenen Bildern) finden. Es ist also ein klassisches Wimmelbildspiel.
Die Schwierigkeit entsteht durch die gleichen Farbgebungen in verschiedenen Facetten. So ist die afrikanische Savanne in ausschlieÃŸlich gelben, orangen und rot-brÃ¤unlichen FarbtÃ¶nen gehalten. WÃ¤hrend das Meer in verschiedenen Blaufacetten gehalten ist. Und der Dschungel ist eben grÃ¼n. Die zu suchenden GegenstÃ¤nde haben eben die Facetten in denen die Bilder gehalten sind.
Anfangs sind die Bilder und gesuchten GegenstÃ¤nde noch recht leicht zu finden - das Ã¤ndert sich in den folgenden, hÃ¶heren "Leveln". Es ist doch sehr knifflig, ein braunes Blatt in einem laubbedeckten Herbstwald zu finden. Aber gerade das macht das Spiel so toll.
Ich hatte mir vorgenommen, das Spiel ohne Hilfe lÃ¶sen zu kÃ¶nnen und bin letztendlich gescheitert. (Was ich absolut nicht schlimm finde)

Die AtmosphÃ¤re ist sehr entspannend, die Musik ist nicht aufdringlich sondern passt zu dem Motiv. Die Farben sind sanft und insgesamt wirkt das Spiel wie gezeichnet, was ich besonders mag.

Ich denke, man KANN dieses Spiel auch mit Kindern spielen, wobei die hÃ¶heren Level doch recht knackig sind. Eventuell wÃ¤re da Hilfe von Erwachsenen nÃ¶tig.

Ich bin noch nicht ganz durch, aber werde das Spiel auf jeden Fall beenden.

Nun die Frage: ist es den Preis wert? JA. Ich wÃ¼rde mir das Spiel auch nochmal zum vollen Preis kaufen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198420198538', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1531038719}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041181154', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1538184785}
review:
Under Leaves is a beautiful atmospheric hidden object game. The two worlds feature wonderfully detailed environments depicted in an amazing analogous color scheme. Each giant stage is broken up into 2-5 panels in which you carefully track down the animal's desired items. The flora and fauna are gently animated to their own personal soundtrack based on their location. You can tell this game was made with a lot of love. Every leaf, pebble and animal was placed with expert care.


The game is very relaxing and a great embodiment of what it is like to be one with nature. It's not a particularly long game, but there is a reset button so you can experience the hunt again. Some stages can be rather tricky, but not in the frustrating way. Make sure you utilize the zoom feature and there are hints available too if you need it. I really hope they continue to update this lovely game.

review: This game is a nice-looking hand-drawn HOG.  It's  100% family-friendly and safe to play with your kids. Older preschoolers can try playing it on their own, but have in mind, however, that some of those objects are tricky to spot. It's not as 'babyish' as it seems to be, don't let those cute and adorable furry creatures fool you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089283166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1520045260}
review: Under Leaves is one of the best hidden objects games found on Steam.  It is a relaxing, calm and casual game for all ages. The design is different from most hidden objects games with original paint-like artistic backgrounds and objects that really make this game stand out from the crowd. It is easy on the eyes and sets a fun mood when playing. The game difficulty is around medium with earlier levels being accessible to any age and ideal for children learning to game on the PC.  The entire game can be played through rather quickly however so savor it.  It should also be noted that whenever you play a stage, the objects are randomly hidden so this makes replaying the game different each time. Recent updates added additional levels and I was happy to go back to this game for more relaxed searching between platforming games. I hope the developer continues adding even more levels over time. Be sure to add this game to your collection if you like hidden object games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061475784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1518937509}
review:
Lovely hidden object game. Pretty, colourful art with soothing ambient noise and music, it's definitely the kind of game you would want to take your time playing.

I really like that the objects in the original locations are cleverly hidden, though I can't say the same for the recent update; it seemed a lot easier and "rushed out". The art in the new locations is also a lot simpler compared to the older locations. But hey, it's a free update, so I ain't complaining. Although, for new players, it might be better if you play the new locations first before the older ones as a way to ease into the game.

Still, the pros outweigh the cons, would definitely recommend this unique little HO game for people who want to have a chill time.

Vom Schwierigkeitslevel ist dieses Game eindeutig fÃ¼r Kinder ausgelegt. Ich habe zum vollstÃ¤ndigen Finden aller versteckten Objekte ungefÃ¤hr eine Stunde gebraucht. 

Die Grafik ist sehr einfach gehalten, aber dennoch schÃ¶n anzusehen. 

GroÃŸes Manko gibt es fÃ¼r fehlende Ingameeinstellungen. Ich rate dazu, das Game nicht mit einem Headset auf dem Kopf zu starten bzw. dieses vorher leise zu stellen. Es gibt Ingame nicht die MÃ¶glichkeit die LautstÃ¤rke zu regulieren. 

Ich habe mir Under Leaves im Angebot fÃ¼r ca. 3,50 â‚¬  gekauft. Mehr wÃ¼rde ich dafÃ¼r aber auch nicht ausgeben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052802708', 'num_games_owned': 1437, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1533118199}
review:
Under Leaves is a delightful game that reminded me a great deal of Botanicula in it's art style. Unlike Botanicula however Under Leaves is not about solving puzzles but merely searching for shapes.

In this respect Under Leavs does an excellent job, the clever use of shape and tones of colour make it glorious to both just admire as well as search for the animals food.

There are a few issues though, it's quite clear the game was designed more with a touch screen in mind, as the mouse often struggles to click but works better when swiping. This felt a little strange to me, since I'm used to more responsiveness when clicking. Movement across the screen was a little weird and the most annoying point was the zooming in and out function that would occasionally require multiple clicks before actually responding to the input.

All in all, the game is beautifully created, and well worth a play as it is quite cheap, plus I enjoyed the additional feel of raising environmental awareness through a video game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273087622', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1519308626}
review: Sometimes you just need to play a simple game and relax. Under Leaves is a colorful hidden object game with an incredibly serene music score. With only 29 levels, it can easily be completed in an hour, still I would highly recommend this game for anyone looking to pass time in a soothing atmosphere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198808110269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1517973759}
review:
My boyfriend bought this game for me as a present because he's cute and knows that I love casual seek-and-find games among many others. Playing this was a lot more fun and was a lot longer than I originally anticipated. While the early levels and the levels in the second area of the map are very easy and short, some of the levels took us a long time and finding everything was challenging! (the All Orange Everything levels made me so grumpy..) The animals are cute and the idea of helping them find what they ask for is really happy. I would recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a cute, casual, affordable game that won't be over after an hour!! I found that it's good to even play if you're with someone because they can participate as well. 
PS. the music and animal sounds are very relaxing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173269005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1517794805}
review: Got it on sale. A great game to wind down with before bed or to relax when anxiety sets in. Super soothing and the objects are never *too* difficult to find.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300747804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1595029910}
review:
A relaxing and fairly easy puzzle game.  The art and music are very lovely.  It's a small game but well-made.  Something which makes it more relaxing than most other hidden object games is that many screens have areas that are more empty, which gives your mind and eyes some breathing room as you search.  The animals are very cute and make a sound or move a little when you get all the food for them.

Edit:  My 5 year old niece loves this game and always wants to pay it when she visits.  A good game for an inquisitive child that loves animals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130135721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1517173084}

author: {'steamid': '76561198151163731', 'num_games_owned': 1632, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1527275216}
review:
Very nice game for children, grand parents, or anyone who likes to find hidden things.
Sounds and graphics are excellent in style.
Not the game genre I go for, but I really liked this game nonetheless.
Only cons: I completed the whole thing in 3-4 hours, using the help only 3-4 times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042619224', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1517074539}
review:
This is a hidden object game with beautifully-drawn watercolour images, each showing a scene in nature. It works entirely without text. In every level, you'll find an animal that you collect food for - starfish, acorns, flowers etc.
There are basically two ways to play this game:

1) Enjoy the gentle background music and sounds and click through the screens in a relaxed manner. At some point, you may have to use the help function because you can't find the last few items. Ah, what a soothing experience, just right for some casual gaming.

2) Notice that the game has an achievement for never using the help function. Scan through every screen meticulously. When that doesn't work anymore, use the magnification function (which you aren't told about! tsk, tsk!! - just double-click on any area of the screen). Search, search again, take a short break, search on and find the last hard-to-spot three-leaf flower. Grit your teeth and repeat for most every later level. Yes, I'm doing this for fun, why are you asking?
Okay, more seriously: If you try to make it entirely without help, your experience may be a bit more demanding in regard to persistence. Your choice!! 

I do recommend this game in any case. Just mentioning that I got 3 h of playtime out of it while using method 2, so make your own judgement on whether you want to get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068476859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1514330225}
review:
Under Leaves a very relaxing, albeit short, hidden object game with a lovely art style.
I completed this game twice on one day, even on the second playthrough some of the objects are very difficult to find. If you get stuck, there is a nice hint system in place with it's own little puzzle to solve before it helps you out.

One point to mention: because of the way objects are hidden, the game will be near impossible to beat for persons with certain types of color blindness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014400185', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1651416583}
review: Beautiful, relaxing puzzle game. Unfortunately it is quite short but still well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151642388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1521590660}
review: I found Under Leaves to be a pleasant casual hidden-object game.  It might have taken me about an hour to play though 20 levels, so it isn't very long.  Unlike some other hidden-object-type games, each level requires you to look for a set amount of one specific object, with variations in color only.  This can sometimes be very difficult; I spent some levels searching a long time for the last item I needed, but others were finished up very easily.  There is no storyline in the typical sense, and the art style is very pleasing and atmospheric, with a soothing soundtrack.  This is a short, relaxing game I'd recommend for the experience if you're looking for something inexpensive to buy, but once you've played it through there isn't much point to playing it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026946873', 'num_games_owned': 1783, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1517076670}
review:
This is a simple search and find game, where you have a certain item to look for, and a area in which to look for it.


Pros:
[i]I love search and find games, so hopefully this review is helpful even with a bit of happy bias. xD[/i]
+The artwork to me is aesthetically pleasing.
+The color scheme is beautiful and works well with the overall art of the game.
+For me it was a easy 100% game. (I LOVE GAMES LIKE THIS) *is totally not a nerd* â™¥uâ™¥
+There were 2 Foxes :DDDDD(FOXES ARE MY FAVORITE ANIMAL)
+It is very tranquil, gives a nice vibe with the soft music.
+Relaxing to play, no time limit to find things, no rush to finish.
+Gameplay was rather smooth, no real hiccups.

Cons:
[i]Honestly none, but I put what I thought could possibly be downsides.[/i]
-The items you look for blend in rather well, so a few are a bit tidious..
-Only 20 levels...So its not that long of a game.

Overall, if you want a relaxing game to 100%, where you don't have to worry about time or anything like that, then this is the game for you. I enjoyed every second of playing time, because they music was so calming for me. If you buy it, I hope you enjoy it like I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970585058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1518902752}
review:
A game with an aardvark in it. So it's obviously really good.

Very stylistic, well drawn and unusual artwork. Nice relaxing music. And things to find by clicking on them. It's an unusual Hidden Object experience, and that's a [i]good[/i] thing. 

Apart from the graphic style, it differs in that you have to collect a certain amount of the same object at a time. Another thing which is different is that most of the 'levels' have multiple screens. This is quite clever, because you can spend ages looking in detail at a particular screen, only to realise later that the object you are looking for isn't even on that screen, or that you've already found all of them on that screen.

I also really like the idea of having a little puzzle to activate the hints. This could be expanded on, as it's pretty trivial. But it does make you feel like you're at least contributing a little effort to get hints, and definitely means you can't do so by accident. I'd love to see a two-tier hint system if there is another similar title; one to show you which screen an object is on, and the other to actually locate it.

A very short but sweet HO game. I highly expect I'll play it again in a while, as it so far is quite unique and rather relaxing.

It also has an aardvark in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012266978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1519160172}
review: After playing Hidden Folks I was in the mood for more hidden object games in that vein, and Under Leaves mostly delivers in that aspect albeit in a much simpler way. The game is relaxing and lovely, with a charming picturebook art style and ambient soundtrack. However, don't go in to this game looking for a challenge--while it does get a little trickier in the later levels, it will not take long to go through the game, and what you see is what you get as there are no interactive areas or puzzles to solve. Sometimes, however, short and simple is all you want!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970728166', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1621106789}
review:
[h1][url=store.steampowered.com/app/567030/Under_Leaves/]Under Leaves[/url] can be pleasantly relaxing if approached without grand expectations. Beautiful, short, unpretentious.[/h1]

Seek simple patterns concealed in a handful of lovely animated watercolor environments, always solely looking for one thing at a time. Complete collections to reveal tiny additions to the world in splatters of complementary color, and unlock the next one.

[h1]Positive[/h1]
[list]
[*] Superbly delicate artwork.
[*] Cute animals and charming environments.
[*] Relaxing ambiant soundtrack and sounds of nature.
[*] Simple controls: drag to scroll, double-click to zoom.
[*] Optionally solve a sliding tile puzzle to receive a hint.
[/list]

[h1]Negative[/h1]
[list]
[*] No puzzles or emerging challenges: everything is in plain sight.
[*] Unfairly same-colored items layered over monochromatic backgrounds may be difficult to spot for younger kids or players with limited eyesight.
[*] Extremely short at full price (less than 2 hours of content).
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198032611592', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1517683751}

This is such a nice game with a calming atmosphere and very pretty artwork. Some respire from the hectic action games!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969752619', 'num_games_owned': 5407, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1498393724}
review:
Beautiful and relaxing Hidden Object game, though a bit short, in that it takes about an hour to complete it.

Probably not for the color blinds out there, but I'm only guessing here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020570262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1497608362}
review: Under Leaves is a beautiful, hidden object game with a soothing soundscape and simple play mechanism. The game does not take long to complete (I've played through twice in my first go), but it is charming and relaxing. I think that this would be a terrific game for children, particularly to join with your child and play together.  As an adult, this will get replayed more for the calming effect than for a challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078973022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1497176534}
review: The game looks easy, but it' not. Even as an adult I had difficulties to find all animals, especially the snake level was hard for me (try to find green salamanders in the green forest ...). For kids it is simple to play and the music and ambient sound create the feeling as if you are really in that environment. And the artwork is perfect for children! Realistic but sweet. Love the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064445036', 'num_games_owned': 1449, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1492961819}
review:
Was ist Under Leaves? Ein Suchspiel in welchem Ihr in wunderschÃ¶nen Screens verschiedene Dinge finde mÃ¼sst um dann in ein neues Level zu kommen. Das Thema ist hierbei Natur und Tiere und ihr kommt alle 5 Level in alte zurÃ¼ck um dort neue Dinge zu finden. Solltet Ihr etwas nicht finden, kÃ¶nnt Ihr auch ein Puzzelspiel machen mit dessen LÃ¶sung Ihr einen Tipp erhaltet wo eines der gesuchten Dinge sich versteckt. Kurz, leider etwas zu teuer, wunderschÃ¶n und fordernt. Kauft es im Sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961133543', 'num_games_owned': 1211, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1495273854}
review:
I'll keep this one short. I loved the game. 
Under Leaves is a short game where you have to look for certain objects hidden in these "worlds" (if you want to call them like that). 

+ The Artwork: Wow, i really loved it. Everything was coherent and fited really well. 
+ The Sounddesign: It matched the visual perfectly and i have never feeled annoyed or anything like that
+ The Gamplay: Short, simple but challenging from time to time. There are some puzzles where you can find the thing really easy but some really take time.
+ Helpoption: It was a good thing, that they implemented that into the game. You feel lost or cant find the last thing you need? Just do a little puzzle and well guide you.

- Well the only negative aspect really is that the game is short. Youll probally get around 1 - 1.5h out of this. 

Well is it worth a buy? Definitely! I enjoyed every second i played. I normally calculate 1â‚¬ = 1 hour of gameplay, which wasnt the case here BUT the game is visually and audibly worth it. If your not sure about buying it id say wait for a sale but definitely pick it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198240887392', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1562468140}
review: This is immensely soothing.  I was looking for a relaxing game, and searching for shapes in beautiful water-colored scenes with pleasant music was just what I needed.  A small detail that I really appreciated was that objects only appeared in biologically suitable places:  acorns could be found only on the ground or in an oak branch, each flower could appear only on certain types of branches, and so on.   I'm really glad I bought this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970858682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1518571872}
review:
*Gnome Seal of Approval*
Took 90 minutes to complete for me. I think that makes it worth its price. Some may disagree.

The game itself is really simple for a hidden objects game. It sure could benefit from more variety, but I still recommend it for fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084354949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1494646780}
review:
Neat little game. 
It's really easy at the beginning, but gets more difficult with each level. 
I beat it in less than an hour, but really enjoyed the art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035577754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1674164708}
review:
Adorable game, although really short. I wish there was more, as is I'm not sure it's worth full price. But if it's on sale, it is great.

One other thing that bothered me was that it wasn't possible to change the volumes of the music and sound effects. The music's good, but since the game is more repetitive, I wanted to listen to a podcast, but couldn't turn off the music without turning off sound effects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176406510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1657035424}
review: i give it 4 stars its  a great game, if your love hidden object games you will love this, its challenging but in the good way and the graphics are amazing some were tricky but thats part of the fun i think it needs more levels and be longer but otherwise i highly recommend it

author: {'steamid': '76561198138437975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1575416066}
review: I'm going to give this a thumbs-up but the game should really be longer. This is a hidden object game all the way. You click on an animal, it gives you an item to find x# of, and then you search the environment for that item. It won't be just one page you're searching and herein lies the challenge. If you get stuck, you'll be looking over multiple scenes multiple times. Under Leaves starts easy but later levels can be quite challenging. At least for me. :p The graphics are unique and beautiful and the music is relaxing and fits each area. You should probably buy this on sale because of the short game length but, if you're a hidden object fan, Under Leaves should definitely be in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081430111', 'num_games_owned': 2542, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1677190514}
review:
[h1]Under Leaves is a cute, colorful, game of hide and seek in which you locate specific items amidst a colorful backdrop. It wonâ€™t take very long to complete, but it will charm you every click of the way.[/h1]

https://youtu.be/b2jZm0RRn9w

Under Leaves is clearly aimed at a younger crowd, but by no means does that mean that a more mature gamer can enjoy it. 

Gameplay is simple; you are tasked with finding specific objects or creatures hidden within a colorful themed background by the creatures who inhabit it. Backgrounds are a range of different biomes from different parts of the world: a wintery iceberg, a sultry, colorful rainforest, a forest drenched in fallâ€™s browns and oranges, a sweltering savanna, and the depths of the ocean. Those are my favorite.

Upon finding what you are looking for, you are rewarded with a change in the scene; this includes additional animals, particle effects, and changes in the animalâ€™s positions.

Much of the gameâ€™s difficulty comes from the complexity of the backgrounds. There are a lot of shades and shapes that camouflage the shapes and shades youâ€™re looking for. You can zoom by double clicking, after which you can use WASD or click and drag in order to look more closely at the scene. The more sets of objects you find, the more difficult the game becomes, because the found objects will still be on screen and will draw your eye in so that youâ€™ll have to redouble your seeking efforts.

While youâ€™re looking, a peaceful melody or more often the chatter of animals will play, creating a serene atmosphere. The atmosphere is the game's strongest point: musical flourishes accompany the click of the item you are looking for. The chirps and trills of the critters on screen are cute as are the animals themselves which will snuggle up to their young ones, bob around, and otherwise provide eye candy.

If the developer made some interactive wall papers, Iâ€™d buy them. The art and atmosphere are just lovely.

.Pros.
[list][*] The game is absolutely charming.
[*] The backdrops youâ€™ll be looking through are beautiful and vibrant. 
[*] Appropriately difficult for both children and more mature gamers.
[*] A great game to complete in an afternoon or to slowly chip away at over the course of a few relaxation sessions.[/list]
.Cons.
[list][*] The game is very short. As enjoyable as the experience is, it only takes about an hour to an hour and a half to completeâ€”depending on how good you are at finding things. [/list]

.Bottom Line.

Under Leaves is a charming seek-and-find for gamers of all ages. If you love animals and are looking for a relaxing way to spend an hour or two, this game is for you. While the content will not take you very long to complete, the sense of wonder that the game's atmosphere creates will stay with you for a while longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042669538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1494080071}
review:
[h1]Relaxation Mode is cranked up to 11 in this simplistic watercolour hidden object game.[/h1]

https://youtu.be/22PmPXLsZXU

You start off on a world map with 21 dotted circles on it. Each level is associated with an animal from that region, and as you complete the levels the map gradually fills with pictures of these animals.

You're introduced to a level by clicking the X on the central animal, which then shows you a speech bubble containing several small icons of the objects  you're looking for (small animals, seeds, fish etc), and the number of items to be found. The overall canvas is split between 3-5 screens, and as you find/click the objects you move on to the next either via the white arrows, or by dragging. You can zoom in and out by double-clicking and then drag the screen around to inspect each area of the panel. When you find the final item you then report back to the main animal whereupon there's a very short animation of baby animals appearing, plants growing or a shoal of fish swimming by. And that, ladies and gentlemen, describes the entire game.

There's no options menu, but you can do ALT-ENTER to switch to windowed, which you can drag to resize, but you'll have to use system controls for the sounds.

[h1]Artwork[/h1]

Everything is in watercolour, with themes to match the type of environment: pale blue/ white in the arctic region; bright greens for South American jungle; browns and oranges for Africa and European woodlands; darker greens for Asian forests; dark blues for the Southern Ocean.

You would normally expect a variety of different items to find in this type of game, but here every object in the level is identical apart from being different shades of the same colour. The idea is that the items are camouflaged against the background.

Art is subjective, of course, but for me it's just too basic, with very few elements to hold my interest. Erm, did I mention there are some animals?

[h1]Sound[/h1]

Relaxing background noises of the outdoors: birds twittering, water running, parrots squawking etc. accompanied by gentle piano tinklings and, as expected, zen-like Japanese string instruments.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]

There is none, really. Half of the game could easily be completed by a 5 year old. The other half I guess you'd need to have reached the grand old age of 7. The zoom feature expands to exactly a quarter of the original screen size, so you can systematically inspect each quarter close-up, and at this point the objects are almost impossible to miss. As if it wasn't easy enough already, there's even a hint option - you have to solve a 3x3 sliding-squares puzzle which is already close to completion before you start and only requires 3-4 moves, which then highlights an undiscovered object.

[h1]Steam[/h1]

There are trading cards and 21 achievements - one for each level, plus one for completing without hints. It's fully cross-platform (Unity game) but no Steam Cloud.

[h1]Value[/h1]

The artwork shows a naive innocence and I think this also extends to the marketing side of things because somebody is blissfully unaware of the quality of games available in this price range. I might pay $1-2 for this to keep the kids happy for a couple of hours, but full price? No chance.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

I can't resist the urge to make a quip about it being like watching paint dry, literally. It's not quite that bad though. It performs well, no glitches or irritations, and the soothing outdoor sounds can give you the illusion of not being a helpless video game addict, even if you are. It's marginally better than watching cat videos on YouTube - at least there are other animals here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021527824', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1577518334}
review:
I have two problems with this game.
First, also the biggest problem for me, is when the ambient music loops, it's very obvious. The music and ambience is beautiful, however when it cuts for a second to loop it really takes me out of it.
Second is the lack of options. It isn't too big of a deal, but a music slider and the option to disable hints would be nice.

Other than those issues, I like this game. It's surprisingly challenging, the music is nice, and it really makes you appreciate the attention to detail in the wonderfully illustrated scenes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054469963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1606659337}
review:
Especially recommended for children since the UI requires no reading and the material is suitable for all ages.

With cute watercolour aesthetic, nature sounds and clever use of camourflage, this is an absolute delight! I wish more hidden object games were along these lines.  Objects are also found in logical, or should I say natural, places. No moonlogic to be found. It is rather short if you have a keen eye or play a lot of this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122444316', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1615053007}
review:
Very nice and relaxing game. The layers keep adding up to the scenery once you progress through the game. The help function is nice too (in order to get the hint you have to complete a puzzle). Some of the things to find are quite difficult while some are easier. 

For about 4 euros this game is a bit too short. I would love to see more levels to this game later. Would definitely recommend if you are looking for a brain tease game which will relax you as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314442490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1492907539}

author: {'steamid': '76561198165729622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1493475019}
review: Absolutely beautiful little game. It shows us the wonderful creatures that exist on our planet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237018508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1663495232}
review:
This is a cute hidden object game. You are moving through a forest/ jungle/ savannah/ bottom of the ocean etc. exploring the habitat of different animals. The goal is to find various different items for each creature (fish for a polar bear etc.) The game is very simple though it can be hard to find some of the objects at times as they all blend so well with the environment. There is a hint button in form of a sliding puzzle if you get stuck. The location of the items changes slightly with every play through so the game has some  replayability.  
 
The game is visually beautiful. The blend of watercolor illustrations and subtle music sets a very relaxing tone.  
 
I'd not recommend the game to those who like story driven or action filled games as there is none of that in here. It's a more relaxing, meditative, anxiety-reducing kind of game. Good for young children or those who want to unwind for a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113862025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 298, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1493298299}
review:
Si je trouve Under Leaves aussi charmant que rÃ©ussi, il m'aura fallu un peu moins d'1h30 pour en voir le bout en ayant dÃ©verrouillÃ© l'intÃ©gralitÃ© de ses 21 succÃ¨s (c'est Ã  dire sans jamais faire appel aux indices - ce qui aurait encore beaucoup rÃ©duit sa durÃ©e de vie).
La question Ã  se poser est donc : "vaut il son prix de base de 5â‚¬"?

Ã€ cette question, je rÃ©ponds non - mais sans pour autant vous dÃ©conseiller ce jeu sympa et bien rÃ©alisÃ© si vous aimez le genre : chopez le sans souci lorsqu'il sera correctement soldÃ©.
[i](Je l'estime trop cher sachant qu'il n'est pas rare de trouver des jeux du genre Ã  la durÃ©e de vie 5 fois supÃ©rieure, vendus de base moitiÃ© moins cher - comme l'excellent "Rusty Lake : Roots" par exemple).[/i]

Si Under leaves ne rÃ©volutionne rien, il se donne en revanche les moyens de ses modestes prÃ©tentions, et rÃ©ussit trÃ¨s bien tout ce qu'il semble ambitionner : Il est vraiment mignon, bien rÃ©alisÃ©, trÃ¨s relaxant, artistiquement irrÃ©prochable (tant sur le plan esthÃ©tique que musical et sonore, avec une apaisante bande-son basÃ©e sur les bruits de la nature)...
Son interface complÃ¨tement dÃ©pourvue de texte est universellement comprÃ©hensible, lisible et bien pensÃ©e.

En terme de difficultÃ©, les niveaux sont gÃ©nÃ©ralement assez enfantins, mÃªme si certains poseront un peu plus de problÃ¨me - mais rien qui ne rÃ©siste Ã  un ratissage minutieux et mÃ©thodique des Ã©crans.

Pour chacun des 20 tableaux, on ne vous demandera de trouver qu'une seule sorte de "forme" (objet ou animal), toujours de la mÃªme taille - mais dans diffÃ©rentes teintes.
Par moment, la difficultÃ© rÃ©side principalement dans le fait que l'objet Ã  chercher est trÃ¨s petit, ou que la teinte est trÃ¨s similaire Ã  celle du fond, donc conseil : oubliez ce jeu si vous jouez sur un petit Ã©cran. (Surtout qu'il ne me semble pas avoir vu de possibilitÃ© de zoomer - et heureusement en un sens, car le jeu en serait devenu encore plus facile - et donc plus court - qu'il ne l'est dÃ©jÃ ).

Le jeu a le bon goÃ»t de faire preuve d'une certaine logique : vous trouverez tous les vers de terre au niveau du sol, les fleurs au bout de leurs tiges, et les Ã©toiles de mer dans les fonds marins, et non en train de crapahuter sur un nuage, comme dans certains jeux du genre.
MÃªme si c'est un dÃ©tail, le fait que l'environnement des animaux et des objets Ã  trouver soit cohÃ©rent est un bon point je trouve.

Je regrette en revanche que les 6 environnements disponibles soient aussi recyclÃ©s tout au long des 20 niveaux proposÃ©s - seuls les animaux et leurs "requÃªtes" changent dans ces 6 grands "tableaux" (qui se dÃ©clinent chacun en plusieurs Ã©crans).

Pas grand chose Ã  reprocher Ã  Under Leaves donc, si ce n'est d'Ãªtre extrÃªmement court et plutÃ´t surÃ©valuÃ© en terme de prix, comme je l'ai dÃ©jÃ  signalÃ© en introduction.
Pour le reste, c'est un (tout petit) jeu 100% objets cachÃ©s, attachant et trÃ¨s correct, que je conseille volontiers aux amateurs du genre si vous le trouvez Ã  moins de 3â‚¬.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204807504', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1493492592}
review: A beautiful, relaxing puzzle/hidden object game. I played it through in one sitting (about 2 hours) and enjoyed it a lot! The watercolor art is stunning! Even though it is quite short, I feel that it definitely has replay value and the price seems fitting aswell. The game also has a hint system (in form of an additional puzzle) in case you get stuck. If you need something to relax with, I would definitely recommend giving Under Leaves a try!
